timeline.message: fix: align text and fill in empty copyright owner
fix: align text and fill in empty copyright owner

timeline.bodyText:
Thanks for contributing!
However I think the brackets are intentional as a few lines above, it says
To apply the Apache License to your work, attach the following
boilerplate notice, with the fields enclosed by brackets "[]"
replaced with your own identifying information. (Don't include

We've already applied such rule to all generated source code.
timeline.author: yihanzhen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@
           same "printed page" as the copyright notice for easier
           identification within third-party archives.
     
-       Copyright [yyyy] [name of copyright owner]
+       Copyright 2020 Google LLC

replies.bodyText: It doesn't make it through rules_gapic. I just tested py_gapic_assembly_pkg.
replies.author: jpoehnelt

replies.bodyText: So we actually don't need it at all - as long as the generated source code have licenses as comments on the top, we don't need a separate license template.
replies.author: yihanzhen

replies.bodyText: I'll revert the brackets, would be nice to keep the text aligned in the license template.
replies.author: jpoehnelt

replies.bodyText: new commit with those changes reverted
replies.author: jpoehnelt
